Situation1: Be patient and understanding of each other's differences.
Situation2: Your I04iend has misunderstood the tone of your text message and replied sounding hurt. You need to call them right now to explain.
Story: I was sitting on the couch, scrolling through my phone, when my little sister stormed into the room, clearly upset about something I’d said earlier. She wanted to talk, to explain how she felt misunderstood and hurt by my offhand comment. I knew I needed to be patient, to listen and show her that I respected her feelings, even if we saw things differently. But just as she started to open up, my phone buzzed with a message from my best friend. She’d misread the tone of my last text and now thought I was angry with her. Her reply was short and wounded, and I could tell she needed me to call her right away to clear things up. I felt torn—my sister’s eyes were searching mine, waiting for me to be the understanding sibling she needed, while my friend was expecting me to reach out and fix our misunderstanding before it grew. My heart pounded as I sat between them, feeling the weight of both expectations pressing in, unsure which role to answer first.
